data.title: Liv Grete Skjelbreid
data.meta_description: Liv Grete Skjelbreid. Actress: Livespiel. Liv Grete Skjelbreid was born on 7 July 1974 in Halandsdalen, Norway. She is an actress, known for Livespiel (2013), Fångarna på fortet (1990) and Mer enn gull (2016). She was previously married to Raphael Poirée.
data.text:
Named Magdalena Forsberg, Zinédine Zidane and Bente Skari the most influential athletes in her career.

Announced her separation from Raphael Poirée in July 2013.

Made her World Cup debut on 6 March 1993.

As a child spent a lot of time with her older sisters, and consequently took part in the sports her sisters did.

Played football, kayaked in the lake, cross-country skied, and she used to run up to the family cottage up in the mountains, touch the wall and run back down.

First started competing in biathlon when she was 9 years old.

Her father built a small shooting range on the family's farm so his young daughters could practice.

As she was finishing high school, was undecided as to whether continue with biathlon or to become a hairdresser.

Has 12 medals from World Championships. 8 of which are gold.

Won a silver Olympic medal in the 15 km Individual race in the 2002 Salt Lake City Olympic Games.

Won a bronze Olympic medal with the Norwegian relay in the 1998 Nagano Olympics.

Won a bronze Olympic medal with the Norwegian relay in the 2002 Salt Lake City Olympics.

In the summer of 1995 broke her wrist whilst swinging on monkey bars.

In the summer of 1997 was jumping on a chair, fell and broke her elbow. Then broke the cast when she crashed while training on roller skis days later.

Her brother-in-law is Norwegian former biathlete and now coach Egil Gjelland.

First met Raphael Poirée at the 1992 Junior World Championships and began dating in 1996.

One of her two sisters Ann Elen also had a career as a biathlete.
